justifications: The Sudanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs said the peace talks would be 'futile' if RSF is allowed to get away with crimes against humanity.
A joint statement from envoys commended RSF for attending the talks and urged them to protect civilians and infrastructure.
The Sudanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs said the peace talks would be 'futile' if RSF is allowed to get away with crimes against humanity.
Tens of thousands of Sudanese have lost their lives, and nearly 11 million people have been displaced.
People are suffering because there are new attacks (both from SAF and RSF) in new places.
The conflict pits the Sudanese Army, led by General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, against the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF), commanded by former al-Burhan deputy, General Mohamed Hamdan Dagalo.
SAF also accused RSF of bombing residential areas in Kordofan and Khartoum, and two schools in Al-Obeid city as well as a hospital in Al-Thawra, Karrari.

entity2.entity: Sudanese Army and Rapid Support Forces

justifications: People are suffering because there are new attacks (both from SAF and RSF) in new places.
The war has left Sudanese civilians without essential food, healthcare, or any semblance of peace.
